alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 28 at 12:36PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: Above freezing temperatures combined with a very wet subtropical system, may cause rapid melt off of snowpack below 5000 feet. Area covered - Lincoln County, including the Fisher and Yaak river. Possible timing of the event - Monday evening into Wednesday Relevant factors Two to three inches of precipitation is expected to fall over the next 48-hours, mostly as rain below 7000 feet. Due to already frozen ground, standing water on roads and low lying or poor drainage areas will be possible. Also, stream and river rises will occur but flooding is not expected at this time. Snow levels and temperatures are expected to lower beginning Wednesday afternoon. This outlook will be reevaluated on Wednesday morning.
